review:
my view my review :-


ajay devgan is back as bajirao singham, an upright officer who is now promoted as dcp of the mumbai 
police. unlike it is shown in the prequel, this time he doesn‚Äôt have to waste time dealing with 
corruption that is prevelent within the system, on the contrary the mumbai police is shown as a 
disciplined force and united like one family, rohit shetty‚Äôs efforts to build a positive image of the 
mumbai police is evident in singham returns, but the filmmaker has unknowingly shown that even the 
police force is a victim of blind belief, i hope in reality the mumbai police does not sit idle 
thinking that the blessings of a sufi phir will take care of all the incidents of robbery taking place 
in the city. bajirao singham has a tougher task this time as he has to locks horns with a fake godman 
essayed by amol gupte who along with a corrupt politcian( zakir hussain) is involved in hoarding black 
money and their men are armed with some of the most deadly wepons. amol gupte‚Äôs getup remindes me of 
the contoversial god man chandraswami, who made headlines throughout the 90s and was accused of 
repeated financial irregularities. the budget of the film must surely have gone up as the number of 
cars reduced to pieces are far more in numbers in comparison to the prequel. kareena kapoor‚Äôs role 
is quite opposite to her figure conscious, low appetite image, she eats everything that her hands can 
lay on, it seems kareena was roped in to add some comedy flavor which unfortunately failed miserably, 
it would have hardly made any difference even if the film didn‚Äôt had a female lead. ajay devgan is at his best 
,certain things that i found common in the prequel and sequel is singham‚Äôs style of walking directly 
into the villain‚Äôs den, striking fear in the hearts of all those who are on the wrong side of law. 
action sequence is too good and exchange of fire between the police force and badmen is lively,actor 
dayanand shetty who is seen in television series cid and is considred a specialist in breaking doors 
does the same act with ease, very true! practice makes a man perfect. i wont say that singham returns 
is better than singham but the sequel deserves an audience, a lot is already spoken about the song ata 
majhi satakli sung by yo yo honey singh so i wont comment on that, but i liked the new title song sung 
by mika, it is not part of the film but is played during the interval, the lyrics describes and 
glorifies singham‚Äôs style, quality and nature, i would call it a singham chalisa.

movie was good but not best.
positives:acting by ajay and other actors,good songs,good actions,good cinematography,gripping emotional scenes and dialogues.
negatives:worst villains ever casted, bad editing, satisfactory screenplay,lack of perfection in gun fight scene,flat jokes.
rohit shetty is a very capable director but this time he missed his mark.
ratings:6/10
